name: NPR
text:
Riley Gale, the vocalist for the metal band Power Trip, died Monday of unspecified causes. He was 34. His bandmates remembered him as a "larger than life rock star and a humble and giving friend."
https://t.co/1F9pFLZtNK

text: WATCH LIVE: The third night of the Republican National Convention. https://t.co/kHQ2XSNWHw

name: NPR
text:
Vice President Pence is the headliner of Night 3 of the #RNC2020, which will focus on "law and order" and feature several prominent GOP women.

Watch live ‚Äî and follow along for fact-checks and analysis üëá

name: NPR
text:
The body of missing Fort Hood soldier Elder Fernandes has been found about 30 miles from the base. His family's attorney said Fernandes had been sexually assaulted by his sergeant, then "hazed for reporting it."

Police say no foul play is suspected.
https://t.co/po5O68gUsm

name: NPR
text:
The 19th Amendment to the Constitution officially took effect 100 years ago today. 

But the fight for women's suffrage was not just about sex. It was also deeply entwined with race. https://t.co/3FLP5dnJaM https://t.co/PWP3PiFELl

name: NPR
text:
Vice President Pence will use Fort McHenry for his #RNC2020 speech tonight, raising concern by some that the historical site is being used for political gain. The Coalition to Protect America‚Äôs National Parks called the move inappropriate.
https://t.co/hMxAW6wbCM

name: NPR
text:
Across China, life has returned to normal ‚Äî except in Xinjiang. Some 22 million people remain under heavy lockdown, many of whom question its severity. 

"The government has used an ax where a scalpel was needed," said a resident.
https://t.co/urosm9cxQq

name: NPR
text:
Sen. Marsha Blackburn said Democrats want to use the government to ‚Äúcontrol‚Äù Americans ‚Äî an allusion to pandemic measures.

She failed to note that local and state governments are making decisions based on federal guidelines by the Trump administration.
https://t.co/7bniYnjorG

name: NPR
text:
Sen. Marsha Blackburn repeated an untrue talking point that Joe Biden would defund the police.

In fact, Biden has publicly opposed the idea that police departments should be defunded‚Äîand has proposed more federal resources for community policing. #RNC2020
https://t.co/dSsa8u08Ky

name: NPR
text:
Kellyanne Conway played a starring role in defending President Trump on television, famously coining the term ‚Äúalternative facts.‚Äù

At the #RNC2020, she said Trump had helped her ‚Äúshatter a barrier in the world of politics."
https://t.co/OGmKCQj9Ex

name: NPR
text:
The pandemic has changed behavior in some quirky, unexpected ways ‚Äî specifically consumer behavior, what people are spending their money on.

Here‚Äôs a look at how 5 habits have shifted:
https://t.co/sZVicWhnLD

name: NPR
text:
Jack Brewer, a member of Black Voices for Trump who spoke at the #RNC2020, was charged with insider trading by the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission earlier this month.
https://t.co/d8koonbYzw

name: NPR
text:
The Milwaukee Bucks refused to take the floor in their playoff game against the Orlando Magic today ‚Äî in protest against systemic racism and the police shooting of Jacob Blake.

Players in the NBA, MLB, WNBA and MLS have followed suit.
https://t.co/neqJOXpjPW

name: NPR
text:
Fact-check: Vice President Pence falsely claimed Joe Biden supports defunding the police.

That's not true ‚Äî¬†Biden has instead proposed a $300 million cash infusion to support community policing and employing more social workers alongside police officers.
https://t.co/qqdkCQseNt

name: NPR
text:
RT @nprpolitics: Vice President Mike Pence expressed sympathy for the toll taken by the coronavirus during his keynote speech.

It was a bit of a turn for an administration, including President Trump, that has been reluctant to dwell on the pain the pandemic has caused. https://t.co/W8WNMEPNqm

name: NPR
text:
In ‚ÄúLovecraft Country,‚Äù a series of connected stories follows characters around and through the very real dangers of being Black in America ‚Äî and not just in the Jim Crow South.
https://t.co/4rcIHpsPqI

name: NPR
text:
Student journalists across the U.S. have been tirelessly reporting on college reopening plans ‚Äî and their editorials haven't held back. 

"Don't make us write obituaries," declared one headline from the student-run paper at the University of Notre Dame. https://t.co/4rgyYP8WpT
